== Main Inclusion Report for dmraid ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/d/dmraid, available for all supported architectures amd64/i386/powerpc/sparc
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for the use of "fakeraid" included on most modern motherboards
** Needed to share partitions with for instance dual-booted Windows using fakeraid
** Should be on the installer CD to allow installing to fakeraid arrays (see also bug <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/22107|#22107]]</nowiki>)
0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=dmraid|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=dmraid|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** The /sbin/dmraid binary runs as root.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'medium'.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:dmraid|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/d/dmraid.html|maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://people.redhat.com/heinzm/sw/dmraid/|upstream]]</nowiki>.  <nowiki>[[https://www.redhat.com/mailman/listinfo/ataraid-list|(mailing list)]]</nowiki>
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/buglist.cgi?component=dmraid&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED&bug_status=MODIFIED&short_desc_type=allwordssubstr&short_desc=&long_desc_type=allwordssubstr&long_desc=|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
** Dedicated <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-dmraid|ubuntu-dmraid]]</nowiki> QA launchpad team.
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper/cdbs/dbs packaging, standard patch system.
0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.
